headline: Local activists file new lawsuit in federal court against Ohio redistricting process
author: Joe Gorman
sentences: Lewis Macklin and community leader Helen Youngblood, is asking a federal court to intervene in the state’s redistricting because they claim minority communities are being diluted by maps proposed by the Ohio redistricting commission, which they say is a violation of the federal Voting Rights Act.
YOUNGSTOWN, Ohio (WKBN) — A trio of city activists have filed a new lawsuit in federal court challenging Ohio’s redistricting process after a similar lawsuit was dismissed last week.
The commission has approved several plans, however, all have been rejected by 4-3 decisions by the state Supreme Court after legal challenges were bought.
Mike Dewine, state House Speaker Robert R. Cupp and Secretary of State Frank LaRose.
A similar lawsuit was dismissed March 23 at the request of the plantiffs.
A new map is expected to be submitted by May 6.
